question: What is India’s rank in the Global Gender Gap Index 2025 released by the World Economic Forum?
solution:
India ranked 131st out of 148 countries in the Global Gender Gap Index 2025, slipping two places from its 2024 rank of 129. The index is published annually by the World Economic Forum (WEF) and assesses gender parity across four key dimensions: Economic Participation and Opportunity, Educational Attainment, Health and Survival, and Political Empowerment.

India’s overall gender parity score was 1%, placing it among the lowest-ranked countries in South Asia.

  • Top-ranked country:Iceland, for the 16th consecutive year, with over 90% parity.
  • India’s rank over the years:
  • 2023: 127
  • 2024: 129
  • 2025: 131
  • India showed improvement in education (97.1%) and economic participation (40.7%), but declined in political empowerment, with female representation in Parliament dropping from 14.7% to 13.8%.

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Unicorn Index 2025 released by the Hurun Research Institute?
solution:
India ranked 3rd globally in the Global Unicorn Index 2025, published by the Hurun Research Institute in June 2025. The index tracks privately held startups valued at over USD 1 billion, known as unicorns, across 52 countries.

  • India has 64 unicorns, a slight drop from 67 in 2024, but retains its 3rd position.
  • Top-ranked country:United States with 758 unicorns, followed by China with 343.
  • India’s top unicorns:Zerodha (USD 8.2B), Dream11 (USD 8B), Razorpay (USD 7.5B).
  • Top sectors in India:FinTech, Gaming, and EdTech.
  • Unicorn capital of India:Bengaluru, ranked #7 globally, followed by Mumbai (#22) and Gurugram (#27).

question: What is India’s rank in the World Air Quality Report 2024 released by IQAir?
solution:
India ranked 5th in the World Air Quality Report 2024, published by Swiss air quality technology company IQAir. The report analyzed data from over 40,000 air quality monitoring stations across 138 countries.

  • India’s average PM2.5 concentration was 6 µg/m³, which is over 10 times higher than the WHO’s safe limit of 5 µg/m³.
  • India improved slightly from its 3rd rank in 2023 to 5th in 2024, showing a 7% decline in PM2.5 levels.
  • Byrnihat (Assam) was declared the most polluted city globally, with a PM2.5 level of 128.2 µg/m³.
  • Delhi retained its title as the most polluted capital city in the world for the 6th consecutive year, with a PM2.5 level of 108.3 µg/m³.
  • Top 5 most polluted countries in 2024:
    1. Chad – 91.8 µg/m³
    2. Bangladesh – 78.0 µg/m³
    3. Pakistan – 73.7 µg/m³
    4. Congo – 58.2 µg/m³
    5. India – 50.6 µg/m³
  • The report highlights that only 17% of cities worldwide met WHO’s PM2.5 guidelines, emphasizing the global air pollution crisis.

question: What is India’s rank in the World Happiness Index 2025 released by the Wellbeing Research Centre?
solution:
India ranked 118th out of 147 countries in the World Happiness Index 2025, published by the Wellbeing Research Centre at the University of Oxford, in collaboration with Gallup and the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network.

The rankings are based on self-assessed life evaluations averaged over 2022–2024, using the Cantril ladder method.

Six key indicators were used:

  • GDP per capita
  • Healthy life expectancy
  • Social support
  • Freedom to make life choices
  • Generosity
  • Perception of corruption

India’s score improved from 054 (2021–23) to 4.389 (2022–24), but it still ranked below Pakistan (109) and Nepal (92).

  • Top-ranked country:Finland, for the 8th consecutive year
  • Bottom-ranked country:Afghanistan (147th)
  • India’s previous ranks:
  • 2023: 126
  • 2024: 126
  • 2025: 118

The report also noted India’s strong social support due to family structures, but low perceived freedom, affecting its overall happiness score.

question: Which country holds the first position in the World Press Freedom Index 2025 released by Reporters Without Borders?
solution:
Norway secured the 1st position in the World Press Freedom Index 2025, published by Reporters Without Borders (RSF). This marks Norway’s 9th consecutive year at the top, with a global score of 31, reflecting its strong legal protections, media independence, and journalist safety.

  • The index evaluates 180 countries based on five indicators: Political context, Legal framework, Economic context, Sociocultural context, and Safety.
  • India ranked 151st, improving from 159th in 2024 and 161st in 2023, but still remains in the “very serious” category.
  • Bottom-ranked country:Eritrea (180th), followed by North Korea (179th) and China (178th).
  • The 2025 report highlights that over half the world’s population lives in countries where press freedom is under severe threat.
  • RSF emphasized growing concerns over economic pressures, editorial interference, and digital censorship globally.

question: What is India’s rank in the Logistics Performance Index 2023 released by the World Bank?
solution:
India ranked 38th out of 139 countries in the Logistics Performance Index (LPI) 2023, published by the World Bank. This marks a six-place improvement from its previous rank of 44 in 2018 and a sixteen-place jump from 54 in 2014.

The LPI evaluates countries based on six key parameters: customs, infrastructure, international shipments, logistics competence, tracking & tracing, and timeliness.

  • India’s port turnaround time was recorded at 9 days, outperforming countries like the USA (1.5 days) and Germany (1.3 days).
  • India ranked 22nd in the International Shipments category.
  • The improvement is attributed to initiatives like PM GatiShakti, National Logistics Policy (NLP), and ULIP (Unified Logistics Interface Platform).
  • Top-ranked country in 2023:Singapore, followed by Finland and Germany.
  • The LPI 2023 emphasized India’s progress in digitization, port modernization, and supply chain visibility.

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Terrorism Index 2025 released by the Institute for Economics and Peace?
solution:
India ranked 14th out of 163 countries in the Global Terrorism Index (GTI) 2025, published by the Institute for Economics and Peace (IEP). The GTI measures the impact of terrorism by analyzing terrorist incidents, fatalities, injuries, hostages, and psychological consequences across the globe.

  • India retained its 14th position, same as in 2024, showing stability in its ranking despite challenges.
  • Top-ranked country (most affected):Burkina Faso, followed by Pakistan, Syria, and Mali.
  • Terrorism-related deaths worldwide declined by 22% in 2024, but the Sahel region remained the deadliest.
  • The Islamic State (IS) was identified as the most lethal terrorist group, responsible for 1,805 deaths across 22 countries, mainly in Syria and the Democratic Republic of Congo.
  • Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) saw a 90% surge in fatalities, emerging as the fastest-growing terrorist group in 2025.

question: Which country holds the first position in the International IP Index 2025 released by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce?
solution:
The United States ranked 1st in the International IP Index 2025, published by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce’s Global Innovation Policy Center. It scored 17%, leading the chart for the 13th consecutive year due to strong performance in patents, copyrights, trademarks, enforcement, and innovation support.

  • The index assessed 55 economies using 53 indicators, including IP protection, enforcement mechanisms, and the commercial environment for innovation.
  • Top 5 countries in 2025:
    1. United States – 95.17%
    2. United Kingdom – 93.98%
    3. France – 93.51%
  • India’s rank:42nd in 2023, 2024, and 2025, with a score of 36.45%, reflecting marginal improvements in copyright enforcement and system efficiency, but continued challenges in patent protection and IP commercialization.

question: Which country holds the first position in the Global Labour Resilience Index 2023 released by Whiteshield?
solution:
Denmark ranked 1st in the Global Labour Resilience Index (GLRI) 2023, published by Whiteshield during the World Government Summit. The index evaluates 136 countries based on their ability to absorb, adapt, and transform in response to labour market shocks such as COVID-19, technological disruptions, and the green economy transition.

  • Denmark topped the cyclical pillar and ranked 4th in the structural pillar, showcasing strong institutional capacity and quick recovery mechanisms.
  • The country implemented a temporary job retention scheme, which minimized unemployment and accelerated post-pandemic recovery.
  • India’s rank:65th, with South Asian peers like Pakistan (97th) ranking even lower.
  • The GLRI serves as a policy guide for governments to strengthen labour market resilience through skills development, citizen-centric reforms, and inclusive employment strategies.

question: What is India’s rank in the Henley Passport Index 2025 released by Henley & Partners?
solution:
India ranked 77th out of 199 countries in the Henley Passport Index 2025, published by Henley & Partners using data from the International Air Transport Association (IATA).

  • This marks a drop from 80th rank in both 2023 and 2024, reflecting reduced global mobility for Indian passport holders.
  • Indian citizens now enjoy visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 57 destinations, down from 60 in 2024.
  • Top-ranked country in 2025:Singapore, offering visa-free access to 195 destinations, reclaiming its title as the world’s most powerful passport.
  • Bottom-ranked country:Afghanistan, with access to only 26 destinations.
  • The index highlights growing disparities in global mobility and the importance of diplomatic outreach and bilateral agreements.

question: What is India’s rank in the Climate Change Performance Index 2025 released by Germanwatch?
solution:
India ranked 10th out of 64 countries in the Climate Change Performance Index (CCPI) 2025, published by Germanwatch, NewClimate Institute, and Climate Action Network International. The index evaluates countries based on four key categories:

  • Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Emissions
  • Renewable Energy
  • Energy Use
  • Climate Policy

Despite slipping two places from its 8th rank in 2024, India remains among the top 10 performers globally, largely due to its low per capita emissions, energy efficiency improvements, and leadership in the International Solar Alliance.

  • Top-ranked country:Denmark (Rank 4), followed by Netherlands (5th) and United Kingdom (6th)
  • Ranks 1 to 3 remain vacant, as no country met the “very high” benchmark across all categories

The CCPI 2025 highlights that no country is yet fully aligned with the Paris Agreement goals, and even top performers have gaps in renewable energy adoption and policy enforcement.

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Hunger Index 2024 released by Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe?
solution:
India ranked 105th out of 125 countries in the Global Hunger Index (GHI) 2024, jointly published by Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe.

  • India’s GHI score: 3, placing it in the “serious” category
  • Previous rank in 2023: 111th, with a score of 28.7
  • Indicators used: Undernourishment, Child Stunting, Child Wasting, Child Mortality
  • Child wasting rate: 18.7% (highest globally)
  • Top-ranked countries (least hunger): Belarus, China, Croatia, Estonia, Hungary, Kuwait (scores below 5)

The report emphasizes that economic growth alone doesn’t guarantee improved nutrition, and calls for targeted interventions like POSHAN Abhiyan, Mid-Day Meal Scheme, and National Food Security Act to address chronic hunger and malnutrition.

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Innovation Index 2024?
solution:
India ranked 39th out of 133 economies in the Global Innovation Index 2024, published by the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO).

  • Rank in 2023: 40th, and in 2015: 81st
  • India ranked 1st among lower-middle-income economies and 1st among 10 countries in Central and Southern Asia
  • It secured 4th position in the Science & Technology Cluster Ranking, with Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru, and Chennai among the world’s top 100 clusters
  • Top-ranked countries in 2024: Switzerland, Sweden, United States, Singapore, and United Kingdom
  • Key strengths: ICT services exports, venture capital received, and intangible asset intensity

question: Which country holds the first position in the Human Development Index 2024?
solution:
Switzerland ranked 1st in the Human Development Index (HDI) 2024, published by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

  • HDI score:970, placing Switzerland in the “very high human development” category
  • Switzerland has held the 1st rank for the 14th consecutive year, consistently outperforming global benchmarks in life expectancy, education, and income levels
  • Top 5 countries in 2024:
    1. Switzerland – 0.970
    2. Norway – 0.970
    3. Iceland – 0.959
    4. Denmark – 0.962
    5. Germany – 0.959
  • India’s rank:134th, with a score of 0.644, classified under “medium human development”

question: What is India’s rank in the Economic Freedom Index 2025?
solution:
India ranked 128th out of 184 countries in the Economic Freedom Index 2025, published by the Heritage Foundation.

  • India’s score:0, placing it in the “mostly unfree” category
  • This is India’s lowest score in 7 years, reflecting challenges in areas like government integrity, labour freedom, and fiscal health
  • India ranked 26th out of 39 countries in the Asia-Pacific region
  • Top-ranked countries in 2025:
    1. Singapore – 83.5
    2. Switzerland – 83.0
    3. Ireland – 82.6
  • The index evaluates 12 freedoms across four pillars: Rule of Law, Government Size, Regulatory Efficiency, and Market Openness

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Democracy Index 2024?
solution:
India ranked 41st out of 167 countries in the Global Democracy Index 2024, published by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU).

  • India’s score:67 out of 10, placing it in the category of “flawed democracy”
  • Previous rank in 2023:66th, showing a significant improvement in democratic indicators
  • The index evaluates countries across five categories: electoral process and pluralism, functioning of government, political participation, political culture, and civil liberties
  • Top-ranked country in 2024:Norway, followed by New Zealand, Iceland, and Sweden
  • Bottom-ranked country:Afghanistan, with a score of 0.00, classified as an “authoritarian regime”

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Aviation Safety Ranking 2023?
solution:
India ranked 55th out of 187 countries in the Global Aviation Safety Ranking 2023, published by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO).

  • Previous rank in 2022:48th, with a score of 49%
  • The ranking is based on ICAO’s Universal Safety Oversight Audit Programme (USOAP), which evaluates eight critical safety elements including legislation, licensing, operations, airworthiness, aerodromes, and accident investigation
  • India’s updated score in 2023: 85.65%, but the rank shifted due to dynamic global audits and revalidations
  • Top-ranked countries in 2023:
    1. Singapore – 99.69%
    2. UAE – 98.8%
    3. Republic of Korea – 98.24%
  • India’s performance remained strong in airworthiness, personnel licensing, and aerodrome safety

question: Which country holds the first position in the Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) 2024?
solution:
Denmark ranked 1st out of 180 countries in the Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) 2024, published by Transparency International.

  • CPI score:90 out of 100, indicating extremely low levels of perceived public sector corruption
  • Denmark has held the top position for the 7th consecutive year, reflecting strong governance, transparency, and institutional integrity
  • Top 3 countries in 2024:
    1. Denmark – 90
    2. Finland – 88
    3. Singapore – 84
  • India’s rank:96th, with a score of 38, shared with Gambia and Maldives
  • The CPI evaluates countries based on expert assessments and business surveys across indicators like bribery, misuse of public funds, and enforcement of anti-corruption laws

question: What is India’s rank in the Global Peace Index 2025?
solution:
India ranked 115th out of 163 countries in the Global Peace Index (GPI) 2025, published by the Institute for Economics and Peace (IEP).

  • India’s score:229, showing a 0.58% improvement from its 116th rank in 2024
  • Previous rank in 2024:116th, with a score of 2.319
  • India performed better than its South Asian neighbors:
    • Bangladesh: 123
    • Pakistan: 144
    • Afghanistan: 158
  • Top-ranked country:Iceland, with a score of 1.095, maintaining the 1st position since 2008
  • The index evaluates peace using 23 indicators across three domains: Societal Safety & Security, Ongoing Conflict, and Militarisation

question: Which country holds the first position in the Global Firepower Index 2025?
solution:
The United States ranked 1st out of 145 countries in the Global Firepower Index (GFP) 2025, published by GlobalFirepower.com.

  • PowerIndex score:0744 (lower score indicates stronger military capability)
  • The U.S. maintains its top position due to unmatched strength in airpower, naval assets, defense budget, and global strategic reach
  • Top 5 countries in 2025:
    1. United States
    2. Russia
    3. China
    4. India
    5. South Korea
  • The GFP Index evaluates over 60 parameters, including manpower, equipment, logistics, geography, and financial resources.

question: What is India’s rank in the World Competitiveness Index 2024?
solution:
India ranked 39th out of 64 economies in the World Competitiveness Index 2024, published by the International Institute for Management Development (IMD).

  • Previous rank in 2023:40th, showing slight improvement
  • The index evaluates countries based on economic performance, government efficiency, business efficiency, and infrastructure
  • Top-ranked country in 2024:Singapore, reclaiming the 1st position after three years
  • India performed well in exchange rate stability, pollution control, and compensation levels, but lagged in business efficiency and infrastructure

question: Which city was ranked the cleanest in India in the Swachh Survekshan 2025?
solution:
Indore was declared the cleanest city in India in the Swachh Survekshan 2025, conducted by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA).

  • Indore has secured the top position for the 8th consecutive year, setting a national benchmark in urban sanitation
  • Top 3 cities in 2025 (Million Plus Category):
    1. Indore
    2. Surat
    3. Navi Mumbai
  • The survey assessed over 4,500 urban local bodies using 54 performance indicators under the theme “Reduce, Reuse, Recycle”
  • Indore’s consistent success is attributed to:
  • 100% door-to-door waste collection
  • Scientific waste processing
  • Strong citizen engagement
  • Garbage-Free City certification

question: What is India’s rank in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) Index 2025?
solution:
India ranked 99th out of 167 countries in the SDG Index 2025, published by the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN).

  • India’s score:95 out of 100, marking its first-ever entry into the top 100
  • Previous ranks:
    • 2024: 109th
    • 2023: 112th
  • India outperformed Bangladesh (114th) and Pakistan (140th), but trailed behind Bhutan (74th), Nepal (85th), and Sri Lanka (93rd)
  • Strong progress noted in:
    • SDG 1 (No Poverty)
    • SDG 3 (Good Health and Well-being)
    • SDG 7 (Affordable and Clean Energy)
    • SDG 13 (Climate Action)
  • Key contributors to India’s rise:
  • PM Awas Yojana, Swachh Bharat Mission, Jal Jeevan Mission, and Ayushman Bharat
  • Solar capacity surged from 2.82 GW to 73.32 GW in a decade

question: What is India’s rank in the QS World Future Skills Index 2025?
solution:
India ranked 25th globally in the QS World Future Skills Index 2025, released by Quacquarelli Symonds (QS).

  • This was the first-ever edition of the QS World Future Skills Index, launched to assess countries’ readiness for future job markets
  • India earned a score of 6, placing it in the category of “Future Skills Contenders”
  • India ranked 2nd globally in the “Future of Work” category, just behind the United States, reflecting strong preparedness for tech-driven roles
  • Top 5 countries overall:
    1. United States – 97.6
    2. United Kingdom – 97.1
    3. Germany – 94.6
    4. Australia – 93.3
    5. Canada – 91.0

India’s performance across key indicators:

  • Skills Fit: Rank 37, Score 59.1
  • Academic Readiness: Rank 26, Score 89.9
  • Future of Work: Rank 2, Score 99.1
  • Economic Transformation: Rank 40, Score 58.3
  • Strengths: AI integration, venture capital attraction, youth workforce, and startup ecosystem
  • Challenges: Sustainability innovation, higher education alignment, and entrepreneurial mindset gaps

question: Which regions were declared fully literate in India by 2025?
solution:
By 2025, the following regions were officially declared fully literate, having crossed the 95% literacy benchmark set by the Ministry of Education under the ULLAS – Nav Bharat Saaksharta Karyakram:

Ladakh – First Union Territory to achieve full literacy

  • Literacy rate: 97%
  • Declared on June 25, 2024 by Lt. Governor Dr. B.D. Mishra at Sindhu Sanskritik Kendra, Leh
  • Achieved through ULLAS mobile app, volunteer teachers, and strong community engagement
  • Marked as functionally literate, covering reading, writing, numeracy, and life skills

Mizoram – First State to be declared fully literate

  • Literacy rate: 2% (PLFS 2023–24)
  • Declared on May 20, 2025 by CM Lalduhoma
  • Driven by 292 volunteer teachers educating 1,692 adult learners
  • Rooted in the Mizo ethos of Tlawmngaihna (selfless service)

Goa – Second state to achieve full literacy

  • Literacy rate: 99.72% (state survey)
  • Declared on May 30, 2025, during Goa’s 39th Statehood Day
  • Success attributed to inter-departmental collaboration and Whole-of-Government approach

Tripura – Third state to be declared fully literate

  • Literacy rate: 95.6%
  • Declared on June 23, 2025, at Rabindra Shatabarshiki Bhawan, Agartala
  • Mobilized 943 Social Consciousness Centres and 2,228 Youth Literacy Corps volunteers

These milestones reflect India’s commitment to inclusive adult education, aligned with NEP 2020 and the vision of Viksit Bharat @2047.
